conclusion: Understanding the problem: rotating coil in a uniform magnetic field, coil has 100 turns and 10Ω resistance, magnetic flux varies sinusoidally with time.
From Figure (Z), magnetic flux Φ follows a sinusoidal pattern with amplitude 2.0 × 10⁻² Wb and period about 6.28 × 10⁻²s.
Magnetic flux can be expressed as Φ(t) = 2.0 × 10⁻² sin(ωt) Wb, where ω = 100 rad/s.
Calculate the EMF using Faraday's Law: EMF = -N × dΦ/dt.
Find the derivative of the flux: dΦ/dt = 2.0 Wb/s × cos(ωt).
Calculate the EMF: EMF = -200 × cos(ωt) V.
Find the maximum EMF: maximum value of cos(ωt) is 1, so |EMF|ₘₐₓ = 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by this alternating current generator is 200 V.
